text: Lagaip-Porgera District (also spelled local as Lagaip-Pogera District) is a district of the Enga Province of Papua New Guinea. Its principal towns are Laiagam and Porgera. ==Administrative subdivisions== The district is divided into four Local Governments: *Lagaip Rural *Maip-Mulitaka Rural *Paiela-Hewa Rural *Porgera Rural ==Demographics== The population of the district was 158,873 at the 2011 census.Districts of Papua New Guinea at statoids.com ==Climate== The average tempiture is 44.6°F . The warmest month is December, at 50°F, and the coolest month is February, at 35.6°F. The average rainfall 124.96 inches per year. {| |- | |} ==Gallery== Gold specimen from Porgera Rural LLG collected in the 1980s. Pogera gold mine. ==References== Category:Districts of Papua New Guinea Category:Enga Province
title: Lagaip-Porgera District
